div.p: Mission Montessori Schools has closed our K-8th grade charter school through the remainder of the school year per the directive from Governor Doug Ducey due to COVID-19. You may reach out to the Principals at principals@missionmontessori.com with any questions and please monitor your Constant Contact communications regularly. Our Infant Room, Toddler Room, and Pre-School are open. There are also child-care options still available for K-8th graders.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_cta_0 et_hover_enabled et_pb_promo et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_no_bg

div.p: With sports programs, chess and theater, yoga classes, summer school, and more offered all year long, Mission Montessori Academy students have a world of enrichment at their fingertips.
Visit The Hub to find classroom pages, event announcements, social media streams, lunch menus, and everything else you need to stay plugged in to our entire range of services and amenities.
Parents, you’ll want to bookmark this one!

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_cta_1 et_hover_enabled et_pb_promo et_pb_bg_layout_dark et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_no_bg

div.p: Each campus serves one of the Planes of Development described by the Montessori teaching method on which our curriculum is based. Our beautiful campuses are located across Scottsdale and connected by a unifying sense of spirit and purpose.

ul.li: Ages 0-6 | Infant, Toddler & Primary | St Anthony / St Apkar Campus
Ages 12-15 | Middle School | St George Campus

div.p: We invite you to learn more about each campus and schedule a tour to see for yourself how Mission Montessori Academy can meet your needs for Pre-K through 8th grade education.

div.h2: Mission Montessori Academy Earns Top Honor From Charter Schools Association

div.p: Our academy has received an A-grade from the Arizona Department of Education for the last three years and is consistently ranked among the state’s highest achieving schools.
We attribute Mission’s success to our global focus, combined with the Montessori philosophy of education, which focuses on a child’s social, psychological and physical development.

iframe.title: 2015 Charter School of the Year of the Arizona Charter Schools Association.

div.p: Mission Montessori Academy students are top performers who consistently earn acceptance to the best high schools and universities.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_4 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_center et_pb_blurb_position_top

div.div: Mission Montessori students consistently score 75% higher than the state of Arizona average on standardized assessments.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_5 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_center et_pb_blurb_position_top

div.div: 100% of 8th grade graduates continue on to International Baccalaureate or honors programs in college preparatory high schools.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_6 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_center et_pb_blurb_position_top

div.div: Montessori primary age students are exposed to world culture, gardening, and practical living skills earlier than traditional schools.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_7 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_center et_pb_blurb_position_top

p.strong: Mission Montessori Academy began as a dream in 1995 and has become an integral and respected member of the Arizona educational community. We are recognized globally, including Charter School of the Year in 2015-16. Our Mission Family works daily to pursue academic excellence, global, and social responsibility, and love and empathy for all life in a safe, nurturing, stimulating and peaceful environment.

et_pb_module et_pb_cta_2 et_hover_enabled et_pb_promo et_pb_bg_layout_dark et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_no_bg

div.p: We are excited to share the Montessori world with you and your child. Whether currently attending or new to the Mission community, your child is already a Montessori student. Every child is born with an innate curiosity about the world and with a desire to learn and explore.

Through years of study and observation, Maria Montessori developed a scientific method of teaching children that integrated their natural curiosity with educational materials within a prepared environment that addressed the needs of each child. This is the experience we want to offer your child.
